info.title: StatusHub API v1
info.description:
# Deprecation warning

This API version is deprecated and [API V2](https://api-docs.statushub.com) should be used instead

# Authentication

Authentication is performed with API Key. To generate API Key please sign in to StatusHub, go to tab "Account" and then choose "API Key" from menu. API Key should be passed as a part of a query string with name api_key.

# Rate limiting

StatusHub API has two rate limits:
- GET requests - 30 requests per second
- All other requests - 5 requests per second

Rate limit is bounded to API Key used for authentication

When rate limit will be exceeded, StatusHub API will respond with:
- 429 response code
- `{"error":"Too many requests - please retry later"}` response
- Retry-After response header

In special cases certain API method may have different rate limit which will be mentioned in API method description

# Time zones

All date/time parameters should be passed in UTC zone no matter the default zone Hub settings

get.description: Returns all hubs to which user has access

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: [Optional] Amount of objects returned in query. Default value: 25. Maximum value: 100

get.description: Returns hub details and services list

post.description:
# Parameters
## position
Is used to determine the position of service in a group. Support special values:
* 0 -> First service in a group,
* -1 -> Last service in a group,
* When this parameter is absent, StatusHub will try to find first matching position based on alphabetical order

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: [Optional] Incident which was present between "start_time" and "end_time"

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: [Optional] Incident which was present between "start_time" and "end_time"

post.description:
Creates new incident

#### Notes:
- You can not create incident with ‘resolved’ status. Incident need at least one another status before you resolved it (investigating, identified, monitoring). Without that incident would have duration 0 as length of the incident is the time difference between last and first incident update,
- If you have no event (incident, maintenance) on your service your service status is always up

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: [Optional] Do not send notification to subscribers

incident_updates.incident_type: Resolved status can't be used for first incident update

parameters.description: [Optional] Amount of objects returned in query. Default value: 25. Maximum value: 100

incident_updates.body:
Due to current problems with database cluster performance we have noticed increased error rate on our API.
We are working on a fix.

#### Notes:
- You can not create incident with ‘resolved’ status. Incident need at least one another status before you resolved it (investigating, identified, monitoring). Without that incident would have duration 0 as length of the incident is the time difference between last and first incident update,

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: [Optional] Amount of objects returned in query. Default value: 25. Maximum value: 100

put.description:
Modifies incident

#### Notes:
- Incident type ‘resolved’ is a special type as it marks the incident end. Because of that there are few restriction of it's usage:
  - There can be not more than one 'resolved' incident updates in incident,
  - 'resolved' incident update has to be last update of an incident

tags.name: ServiceStatus (Deprecated)
tags.description:
**UPDATE** Multi Service Incident release - 2017-12-05:
- Those API functions are now deprecated 
- DELETE method on Service Statuses has been removed
- CREATE will now create also generic incident along with service status
